of frozen ground tissue.

source.body: Lay the tube down horizontally to maximize surface area during RNA extraction.

Transfer the top aqueous phase to a new 1.5 ml RNase-free tube.
Vortex the tube until the phases mix and appear cloudy.

Centrifuge at

Transfer the top aqueous phase to a new 1.5 ml RNase-free tube.

Centrifuge at
for
.
Transfer the top aqueous phase to a new 1.5 ml RNase-free tube.
Pour the contents of the tube into a Qiagen mini RNA spin column (pink), until the column is almost filled with liquid.
Cap the tube.
Discard the flow-through from the collection tube.
Repeat the previous two steps with the same mini RNA spin column, until all of the liquid in the tube(s) has been passed through the column.

source.body: The nucleic acid is now bound to the silica membrane in the spin column.

source.description:
Apply
of solution RW1 to the spin column.
Cap the tube.
Discard the flow-through from the collection tube.

Apply
of solution RPE to the spin column.
Discard the flow-through.
Repeat previous two steps one time.

Spin at maximum speed for
to remove remaining liquid from the silica membrane.
Transfer the spin column to a new 1.5 ml conical bottom microcentrifuge tube.

Add
–
of RNase-free water to the column.

Spin at maximum speed for
to collect RNA solution.
Mix by briefly vortexing or flicking the bottom of the tube until the sample is thoroughly re-suspended.

Transfer the supernatant to a new
RNase-free tube.
Vortex vigorously.
Add an equal volume of 5:1 acid phenol:chloroform to the tube.

Incubate at
for
.
Add to the aqueous phase equal volume of 24:1 chloroform:isoamyl alcohol.
Vortex the tube until the phases mix and appear cloudy.

Then incubate at
for
.
Add 1/2 volume of 100 % ethanol.

Centrifuge at
for
.

source.body: The column should be empty at the end of this spin.

description: This protocol is part of a collection of eighteen protocols used to isolate total RNA from plant tissue. (RNA Isolation from Plant Tissue Collection: https://www.protocols.io/view/rna-isolation-from-plant-tissue-439gyr6) and was originally published as part of Appendix S1 of "Evaluating Methods for Isolating Total RNA and Predicting the Success of Sequencing Phylogenetically Diverse Plant Transcriptomes" Marc T. J. Johnson et al. PLOS ONE, November 21, 2012. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0050226
